Description: Rim sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: dot and billet patterns framing maeander band at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of undetermined animal (possibly the wing of a goose, the mane of a lion, or the crest of a boar); pendant triangle and roundel and dotted cross as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, as the sherds from this group display patterns on the different parts of the vessel which are similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 236, no. 161, pl. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0147) (phase 2)
